metadata.Title: CVE-2011-1193 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 10.0.648.127, allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1193` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
